body_text: From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia Lithuanian supermarket chain Čia Market, UAB Native name Čia Market Industry Retail Founded 1996 ( 1996 ) Headquarters Telšiai , Lithuania Area served Lithuania Key people CEO Aurelijus Vaitiekus Revenue € 48.321 million [ 1 ] Operating income - €0.420 million Net income - €0.414 million Total assets €4.553 million Total equity - €0.482 million Number of employees 561 (2022) Website www .ciamarket .lt Čia Market shop in Druskininkai Čia Market from side Čia Market is a supermarket chain in Lithuania . In 2022, it was 10th largest chain of retail stores in Lithuania. In 2018, company had around €0.9 million in financial loses while having around €54 million in turnover. [ 2 ] [ 3 ] In 2019, the employees of the Čia Market shop in Panevėžys could not stand any longer and complained to the food quality inspectors about the possible large-scale cheating of customers. Some of the products were expired for 2 years. [ 4 ] In 2020, due to financial losses the company closed 24 shops. [ 5 ] In 2022 company expected to reach €48 million in revenue. [ 6 ] History [ edit ] UAB "Čia Market" is a company from Samogitia region. At first it was named "Žemaitijos prekyba" and it only was selling dairy products . In 2011 the company changed its name to "Čia Market". [ 7 ] List of supermarket chains in Lithuania This Lithuanian corporation or company article is a stub .
